Equipped creature gets +1/+1. If it's a Knight, it gets +2/+2 instead.
Equip {3}
cards.flavor_text2: [i]Sometimes. Other times, it's just who your parents were.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Enchant opponent
Enchanted player can't cast spells that share a name with a card in their graveyard.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]Remember sin, remember shame,
Forget your joys, forget your name.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains “When this creature dies, draw two cards”. Then it fights target creature you don't control.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I know that you do not fear war. But you should fear what war will make you do.”
—Farajo, to the knights of Vortheld[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When A King's Ransom enters, create two Treasure tokens. [i](They're artifacts with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)[/i]
Tap two untapped Treasures you control: Create a 1/1 black Mercenary creature token. Activate only as a sorcery.

Each player may draw two cards. Each player who does loses 2 life, and each player who doesn't gains 4 life.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Demons can't lie. But they really don't need to.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Flying
Whenever Giant Slayer deals damage to a creature with power 4 or greater, destroy that creature.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The problem with slaying a giant is that you have to dodge the falling corpse.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Cavalier Cavalier attacks each combat if able unless it's paired.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Why should I be careful? Nobody cares whether I live or die.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. It gains haste until end of turn. When it dies this turn, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The winner of Vrek's great contest receives the undying loyalty of its inhabitants. Even if they're a child, a dog, or a ghost.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i](You can attack this. Opponents block for this. Damage removes counters.)[/i]
When Quest for the Holy Blade has no quest counters on it, transform it.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Nearly as many have died looking for it as were once killed with it.[/i]
cards.rules_text2:
Equipped creature gets +5/+0 and has first strike and trample.
Equip {0}
cards.flavor_text2: [i]With this blade in hand, the first Emperor conquered the world. Or at least the non-elven parts of it.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I've had enough of adventures and entirely too much of getting cursed. Zineva and I intend to live ordinarily ever after.”
—Kath, the Dragonslayer[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Equipped creature is a Cat with base power and toughness 4/4, has trample, and loses all other abilities and creature types.
Equip {2}
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“It's easy. You j-just need a t-token of respect from the animal whose shape you want.”
—Vasilisa, Yaragi witch[/i]

cards.rules_text: {T}, Shuffle Wishing Fish into its owner's library: Reveal a noncreature card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Please, fisherman. Throw me back, and I will grant you a wish.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Look at the top six cards of target opponent's library, exile two of them, and put the rest into their owner's graveyard. You may cast those cards for as long as they remain exiled and may spend mana as though it were mana of any type to do so.
When Lady of the Lake enters, search your library for an Equipment or Quest card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle.
cards.flavor_text: [i]When the keepers of Vortheld's ancestral treasures spoke against him, Luton declared them impostors.[/i]

cards.rules_text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, exile the top card of your library. Each player secretly bids an amount of life. The winner loses that much life and may play the card as long as it remains exiled, spending mana as though it were mana of any type to do so. You decide who wins ties.
Holy Fire deals X damage to any target. You gain X life.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“We pray to anything that's willing to listen, and we take whatever power they're willing to offer in return.”
—Zara, Pontiff of Azoria[/i]

cards.rules_text: Create ten 1/1 red Peasant creature tokens with haste and “This creature attacks each combat if able”.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“This is why hereditary monarchy is a bad way to run things.”
—Farajo, extraplanar mediator[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Haste 
This creature attacks each combat if able.

Trample

cards.flavor_text: [i]Azorian law demands monogamy. Only the bravest heretics dare celebrate love in all forms.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying, prowess
Whenever Witch's Heir attacks, up to one target creature loses all abilities and becomes a 1/1 Frog until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The witches of Yarag protect their peasants as diligently as any knight.[/i]
[i]A fitting punishment for one who would mistreat their own children.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of each upkeep, put a blight counter on Tyrant's Mark.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each blight counter on Tyrant's Mark.
When enchanted creature dies, return Tyrant's Mark to the battlefield transformed.
cards.rules_text2:
Flying, deathtouch
When Children of the Nameless God enters, search your library for a card named Tyrant's Mark and put it into your hand. Then shuffle.

cards.rules_text:
Marriage [i](At beginning of combat, you may pair this monogamously with another creature for as long as you control both.)[/i]
{R}: Dragon-Kissed Princess or a creature paired with it gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life and create a 1/1 black Insect creature token.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“This tyrant will bring the judgment of the Nameless God upon us.”
—Brother Charl, Azorian monk[/i]

cards.rules_text: Draw three cards. Then discard two cards unless you discard an enchantment card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Azorian Church maintains a library in every monastery and a school in every church. Its priests are educators and storytellers as well as spiritual guides.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains deathtouch until end of turn. If it's a Wizard, it also gains indestructible and lifelink until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Dangerous in the wrong hands. Deadly in the right ones.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}: Mighty Castle becomes a 0/5 Wall artifact creature with defender until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]A king without a castle is not likely to be a king for very long.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
When Faerie Godmother enters, you may search your library for an Aura card, reveal it, and put it into your hand, then shuffle.

Ward {4} [i](Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays {4}.)[/i]
{1}: Target land becomes a 5/5 Elemental creature with trample and haste until end of turn. It's still a land.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Not even the dirt dares to disobey.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {2}, {T}: Create a Treasure token. [i](It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)[/i]
cards.flavor_text:

—Rendivaktokov, demon[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Miserly Dwarf-Lord dies, create a Treasure token. [i](It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]In human lands, “dwarf-like” is high praise for a craftsman and a terrible insult for a miser.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}, {T}: Put a growth counter on Royal Garden. Then if there are three or more growth counters on Royal Garden, remove them all and transform it.

cards.flavor_text2:
[i]“We have no idea where you'll end up if you climb it. Is anyone here brave enough to find out?”
—Katarina, gardener[/i]

Flying

cards.flavor_text: [i]In Uya, the Owl Caste is responsible for scholarly pursuits. Legally, all scholars are considered owls.[/i]

Flying, lifelink
When Demon of Temptation enters, each player may search their library for a card and put it into their hand. Each player that does loses 6 life and shuffles. Each player that doesn't gains 6 life.

Prowess
Curse spells you cast cost {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} less to cast. This effect reduces only the amount of colored mana you pay.
Whenever you cast a Curse spell, you may draw a card.

—Kobolok the Demon-Buyer[/i]

cards.rules_text: Flying, lifelink

Enchant creature 
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

At the beginning of your end step, if you gained life this turn, scry 1. Then if you gained 3 or more life, draw a card. Then if you gained 7 or more life, create a token that's a copy of Pious Farmer.
